medical_history.chief_complaint: 24 hours of epigastric pain and nausea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 24 hours prior to presentation, characterized by epigastric pain described as unlike any previous pain experienced. Associated with nausea, but no vomiting. The patient had a bowel movement yesterday but has not passed gas since. No history of obstructions in the past. No fevers, chills, nausea/vomiting, melena, hematemesis, hematochezia, or weight loss. Normal urine and stool color.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Significant for hypertension. No history of asthma, mitral valve prolapse, coronary artery disease, peripheral vascular disease, cerebrovascular disease, or thromboembolic disorder. Up-to-date with mammography and colonoscopy. Past surgical history includes a right knee replacement and re-replacement, and a left knee replacement 'many, many years ago.'
medical_history.family_history: Denies any family history of cancer.
